sect2.para: The Linux Kernel contains a make target that installs sanitized kernel headers.

sect2.title: Installation of Linux Headers
sect2.para: For this step you will need the kernel tarball. This is the first section that requires knowledge about the development platform, which for this book is the basic 32-bit pc The primary information we need at this time is the architecture (ARCH) for this platform. Our first step will be to set the CLFS_ARCH parameter:
Install the header files that are common to all x86 platforms:

screen.userinput: make mrproper make headers_check make INSTALL_HDR_PATH=dest headers_install cp -rv dest/include/* ${CLFS}/usr/include

sect2.para: Create a default kernel configuration. This will be used later to determine the settings for other key variables:

screen.userinput:
cp arch/x86/configs/i386_defconfig .config
yes "" | make oldconfig cp .config ~/x86_myconfig
